articles.title: Scout's Analysis: Breaking down Canada's world junior roster
articles.description: Jason Bukala takes a look at each player who made the cut for Team Canada's roster at the world junior hockey championship.
articles.content:
As the city of Ottawa prepares to host the 2025 world junior hockey championship from Dec. 26 to Jan. 5, Team Canada announced its roster of 25 players after making their final cuts on Friday evening.
The tournament is generally looked at as a "U20" ... [12181 chars]

articles.title: Parked car goes up in flames sending black smoke over Barrie parking lot
articles.description: A parked car went up in flames creating a plume of dark smoke over a Barrie parking lot.
articles.content:
A parked car went up in flames creating a plume of dark smoke over a Barrie parking lot.
On Friday, just after 2 p.m. Barrie Fire responded to a vehicle fire in the Bryne Drive parking lot in Barrie.

articles.title: Alberta military base where Prince Harry trained faces uncertain future
articles.description: A sprawling military training base more than twice the size of New York City in southeastern Alberta appears to be a shadow of its former self while its future use remains up in the air.
articles.content:
A sprawling military training base more than twice the size of New York City in southeastern Alberta appears to be a shadow of its former self while its future use remains up in the air.

articles.title: GST tax break in Ontario 'pain in the butt' for some retailers
articles.description: Some small businesses in Ontario think the upcoming holiday tax break is a “pain in the butt” that could potentially cause issues before and after the policy is over.
articles.content:
It's an announcement meant to appeal to cash-strapped Canadians—a tax break impacting everything from groceries to children's clothes to diapers—and it will last for two months.
